    • Method Detail

      • plugin

        public Plugin plugin(String name)
        Simply try to get plugin object directly. *

        Example) #MESSAGE "spawn region info: "+plugin("WorldGuard").getRegionManager(player.getWorld()).getRegion("spawn")

        Parameters:
        name - name of the plugin.
        Returns:
        Plugin object on success; null if plugin not found or loaded.

      • takeItem

        public boolean takeItem(Player player,
                        int id,
                        int amount)
        take item from player.

        Example) /trg run IF takeItem(player, 1, 1); #MESSAGE "Removed one stone."; ELSE; #MESSAGE "You don't have a stone"; ENDIF;

        Parameters:
        player - target player
        id - item id
        amount - amount
        Returns:
        true if took it; false if player doesn't have it

      • takeItem

        public boolean takeItem(Player player,
                        int id,
                        int amount,
                        int data)
        take item from player.

        Example) /trg run IF takeItem(player, 1, 1, 1); #MESSAGE "Removed one granite."; ELSE; #MESSAGE "You don't have a granite"; ENDIF;

        Parameters:
        player - target player
        id - item id
        amount - amount
        data - data of item
        Returns:
        true if took it; false if player doesn't have it

      • locationEqual

        public boolean locationEqual(Location loc1,
                             Location loc2)
        check if two location are equal not considering their decimal points

        Example) /trg run IF locationEqual(player.getLocation(), {"otherLocation"}); #MESSAGE "match"; ENDIF;

        Parameters:
        loc1 -
        loc2 -
        Returns:
        true if equal; false if not

      • makePotionEffect

        public PotionEffect makePotionEffect(String EffectType,
                                     int duration,
                                     int amplifier,
                                     boolean ambient,
                                     boolean particles,
                                     Color color)
        create a PotionEffect for use in entity.addPotionEffect();

        Example) /trg run player.addPotionEffect( makePotionEffect("SPEED", 1000000, 5, false, true, bukkitColor(21,2,24) ))

        Parameters:
        EffectType - the name of the PotionEffectType to use
        duration - how long the potioneffect should last when applied to an enitity
        amplifier - how strong the effect should be
        ambient - if true particle effects will be more transparent
        particles - if false potion particle effects will not be shown
        color - sets the color of the potion particle effects shown
        Returns:
        returns a PotionEffect object or null if specified PotionEffectType was not found.

      • player

        public Player player(String name)
        try to get a player from name. Mostly online player.

        Example) player("wysohn").performCommand("spawn")

        Parameters:
        name - name of player
        Returns:
        the Player object; it can be null if no player is found with the name

      • oplayer

        public OfflinePlayer oplayer(String name)
        try to get offline player from name.

        Example) /trg run #MESSAGE "UUID is: "+oplayer("wysohn").getUniqueId()

        Parameters:
        name - name of player
        Returns:
        the OfflinePlayer object; it never returns null but always return an offline player even if the player doesn't exist.

      • getPlayers

        public Collection<? extends Player> getPlayers()
        get list of online players online

        Example) /trg run FOR p = getPlayers(); p.performCommand("spawn"); ENDFOR;

        Returns:
        player iterator

      • currentArea

        public String currentArea(Entity entity)
        Get the name of area where entity is currently standing on.

        Example) /trg run #MESSAGE "You are in the AreaTrigger named: "+currentArea(player)

        Parameters:
        entity - any entity(including player)
        Returns:
        name of area; null if player is not on any area.

      • currentAreaAt

        public String currentAreaAt(Location location)
        Get the name of area trigger at the target location.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to check
        Returns:
        name of area; null if there is no area trigger at location

      • getEntitiesInArea

        public List<Entity> getEntitiesInArea(String areaTriggerName)
        Get list of entities tracked by this AreaTrigger.
        Parameters:
        areaTriggerName - name of AreaTrigger to get entities from
        Returns:
        List of entities. null if the AreaTrigger with specified name doesn't exist.

      • color

        public String color(String str)
        Translate & into minecraft color code

        Example) /trg run player.sendMessage(color("&aGREEN, &cRED"))

        Parameters:
        str - unprocessed string
        Returns:
        string with minecraft color codes

      • bukkitColor

        public Color bukkitColor(int red,
                         int green,
                         int blue)
        creates and returns a bukkit color object using the RGB values given. the max value for the int arguments is 255 exceeding it may cause errors.

        Example) /trg run partColor = bukkitColor(255,255,255)

        Parameters:
        int - red the value of red in RGB
        int - green the value of green in RGB
        int - blue the value of blue in RGB
        Returns:
        returns a Color object from org.bukkit.Color

        Example) /trg run #GIVE item(1, 64, 0)

        Parameters:
        type - typeId
        amount - amount of item
        data - data
        Returns:
        the ItemStack

      • formatCurrency

        public String formatCurrency(double money,
                             String locale1,
                             String locale2)
        Translate money into specified country's currency format. You need to provide exact locale provided in http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/java8locales-2095355.html
        Overrides:
        formatCurrency in class CommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        money -
        locale1 - language code (Ex. en)
        locale2 - country code (Ex. US)
        Returns:
        formatted currecy

      • formatCurrency

        public String formatCurrency(double money)
        Translate money into specified country's currency format. US currency will be used.
        Overrides:
        formatCurrency in class CommonFunctions
        Parameters:
        money -
        Returns:
        formatted currecy

      • headForName

        public ItemStack headForName(String targetName)
        Create a player head with given name.

        Example) /trg run #GIVE headForName("wysohn")

        Parameters:
        targetName - name of the owner of head
        Returns:
        the ItemStack head

      • headForName

        public ItemStack headForName(String targetName,
                             int amount)

      • headForValue

        public ItemStack headForValue(String textureValue)
        Create a player head with given textureValue(base64 encoded).

        Example) /trg run #GIVE headForValue("eyJ0ZXh0dXJlcyI6eyJTS0lOIjp7InVybCI6Imh0dHA6Ly90ZXh0dXJlc y5taW5lY3JhZnQubmV0L3RleHR1cmUvN2RjZDdkZjUyNjQ1YzY4Y2RhZDg1NDhlNjFiM2Y3 NjU5NjQwNzcyMjZiYTg3MmI5ZDJiZDQ1YzQzOWQifX19\\")

        Notice that there is an extra \ sign as \ is an escape sequence. The final String will be ...OWQifX19\ instead of ...OWQifX19\\"

        Parameters:
        textureValue - base64 encoded texture value
        Returns:
        the ItemStack head

      • makeBossBar

        public BossBar makeBossBar(String title,
                           String color,
                           String style)
